intro: Quercus benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham oak, is a species of evergreen oak native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a glossy green surface. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pale yellow to greenish in color. Its acorns are enclosed in a cupule and are an important food source for various wildlife species. This tree thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
